*[[Ubuntu JeOS]] (pronounced as "juice"), is described as "an efficient variant [...] configured specifically for [[virtual appliance]]s".<ref>{{ cite web | title = Ubuntu JeOS 7.10 released | url = https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-announce/2007-November/000106.html }}</ref>

*[[Ubuntu Mobile and Embedded Edition]] is an embedded operating system designed for use on [[mobile devices]]. The operating system will use [[Hildon]] from [[maemo]] as its [[GUI|graphical frontend]].
+
*[[Ubuntu Mobile]] is an embedded operating system designed for use on [[mobile devices]]. The operating system will use [[Hildon]] from [[maemo]] as its [[GUI|graphical frontend]].
* [[Ubuntu Netbook Remix]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13580_3-9950552-39.html|title=Ubuntu to announce its mobile Linux in June}}</ref> to be released later in 2008,<ref>[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/netbook-remix Canonical Showcases Ubuntu Netbook Remix at Computex | Ubuntu<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> is an official derivative of Ubuntu designed for [[netbook]]s using the [[Intel Atom]] processor.
* [[Ubuntu Netbook Remix]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13580_3-9950552-39.html|title=Ubuntu to announce its mobile Linux in June}}</ref> to be released later in 2008,<ref>[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/netbook-remix Canonical Showcases Ubuntu Netbook Remix at Computex | Ubuntu<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> is an official derivative of Ubuntu designed for [[netbook]]s using the [[Intel Atom]] processor.
